revised_title: Determining Surface Tension of Exposed Water Surfaces
tldr: The author presents a rapid method for determining the lowering of tension in exposed water surfaces, using drops of solutions containing a spreading oil in a non-spreading oil. This method can detect small amounts of oily contamination and estimate the surface tension of various water surfaces, including sea and inland waters. The study shows that open-sea water is generally clean, while creeks, small harbors, and confined water areas may have lower surface tension due to contamination.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Water Chemistry
